blog.name: lovely-cri
blog.title: Sweet dreams
blog.description:
Cristina. 

 "It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world." Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

summary:
My heart broke during the scene with Ghost.
I know that many wanted a goodbye between him and Jon, I wanted it too, but do you...
body:
My heart broke during the scene with Ghost.

I know that many wanted a goodbye between him and Jon, I wanted it too, but do you really think that Jon could have let Ghost go in that case?

Jon is right, Ghost will be better in the North where he grew up and spent most of his life. In the South he would suffer and would not be happy in Winterfell without him.

And Ghost has always been where Jon would like to be. To Winterfell to protect Sansa, in the front row during the battle against the Night King and now he will be in the North while Jon goes to war against Cersei.

I know all this, but my heart is still broken. All I want is to be able to give them some more time together. I hope Jon survives and comes home to his family and Ghost.

summary: This will probably never happen but hear me out.  Tormund didn’t say that the Free Folk were leaving immediately, that they were...
body:
This will probably never happen but hear me out. 

Tormund didn’t say that the Free Folk were leaving immediately, that they were going to wait until the weather got better. The reason Jon and Tormund were saying goodbye for good was because Jon knows that he has to stay in the south with Dany even though he doesn’t want to. And the visual effects supervisor said that Ghost would be doing cool stuff this season - that hasn’t happened yet - so there’s a good chance that we will see Ghost again this season. 

They spent multiple scenes in this episode showing us how people admire and follow Jon and one of those scenes was Tormund himself shouting for everyone to hear about all the things he’s done that made people follow him. 

Now. Targbowl is a surefire thing at this point but what if the Free Folk hear that Jon and Dany are going to fight each other and they /know/ that Dany’s army is superior to Jon’s so they pack up and head south and Ghost comes with them.

Or better yet, they /have/ already left for Beyond-the-Wall and hear about Jon retreating with the North and the Vale back to Winterfell and Dany’s coming for them so Tormund gets the Free Folk turned around because like fuck is he going to let a foreign dragon queen kill his buddy and invade the North (which would be a bit poetic since Tormund constantly refers to the North as being south compared to beyond the wall).

I just, i need someone to write me a fanfiction where this happens and like, Jon is getting his ass kicked by one of Dany’s Dothraki bloodriders or an Unsullied soldier and Ghost just comes out of fucking nowhere and saves him. Just. Someone please write this for me, thanks.

blog.name: muchmorethanwhispers
blog.title: Much More Than Whispers
blog.description: Minding my own business and sharing it with you

summary: GOT S8 EPISODE 4 - Spoilers and Theories
body:
GOT S8 EPISODE 4 - Spoilers and Theories

This is just a list of thoughts I have so far:

1. JON SNOW KNOWS NOTHING: how does he just throw his whole Stark identity out of the window like that? Telling “his brother and sisters” they are practically nothing. Is like Lyanna’s ancestry doesn’t weigh on his. He is still a Stark. I understand he was raised to feel inferior but he was always proud of Ned and loved his singlings. And why the fuck does he just dismissed Ghost like that? Ghost is in his fucking sword! Is he gonna have it reshaped to be a Dragon now? Ugh 😑 I think the whole Ghost thing is either foreshadowing Jon’s return to the Night Watch or even beyond the wall or his lost identity that will be his downfall… as Sansa mentioned on this episode: “Stark men dont do well in the South”. He does not deserve the Iron Throne even though every one keeps shoving it down his throat. I’m done with Jon/Aegon. What is he thinking: he doesn’t identify as a Stark, he said he loved Dany but still went ahead and told the other Starks their secret… uuugggh. The worst is that he is the only character who doesn’t want to live and I think he is going to make it until he dies of old age 🤦🏻‍♀️

2. SANSA WTF? Selfish little Sansa… I loved her moment with The Hound, her moment saying good bye to Theon but that’s it. She’s the new Littlefinger, but I dont think she really wants the Throne, she just wants some sort of justice for the North. However, what she just triggered by telling Tyrion is going to reshape the whole story. And I think in the end the North will be the new capital and she will be the new queen but won’t be happy… she’ll mirror Cersei and Littlefinger in many things.

3. DANY… I am convinced now that she will be indeed go full Mad Queen. After all that she’s lost (2 Dragons, her best friend and her loyal protector plus the entire Dotraki army and like 75% of the Unsullied) only to see how a man takes all the credit is definitely going to take a toll on her mental state. She meant well by trying to be righteous and destroying the wheel but now she’s all about revenge. She doesn’t really trust the people around her anymore and she’s been held back many many times… I’m sure she will do whatever she wants and this will trigger Varys to act against her. However, I really think Jon will kill her, a new Queen Slayer and this will be her 3rd betrayal. I think Drogon is gonna burn the hell out of Euron.

4. VARYS AND TYRION: I can see Dany executing both of them for conspiracy. And then Dany will suspect Jon as well because he was the one who told Sansa the truth. Maybe Tyrion could survive but I’m not so sure.

5. JAMIE and CERSEI… I truly want to believe he is going back to Kings Landing to try to fix things with Cersei, and try to convince her of running away together or something. I could see Cersei killing him for being a traitor, for leaving her and accusing him of the loss of their unborn child. She’s paranoid so I think that once she sees herself loosing, she will kill herself by Jamie’s corpse side. Very Romeo and Juliette like.

6. ARYA… it was very on point for her to refuse Gendry on those terms of being a lady at a castle. I think she will help the Hound kill the Mountain and finally giving the Hound the gift of mercy. Afterall she’s regained contact with her humanity. I do see her going back to Storm’s End and being with Gendry but as a Master of arms or something on her own terms and him of course supporting her.

7. BRIENNE AND POD: I can see Brienne as the hand of Sansa and Pod as a Knight. Also, there’s room for Brienne to be having Jaimies twins. Afterall, it was kind of foreshadowed during thr drinking game by bringin up thr fact that she was an only child and a virgin.

8. Sam: I’m not sure if Sam’s role was just to read about dragon glass killing the white walkers but I’m sure he will write everything that happened on that night and will go back to his family’s castle.

9. Bran: I’m sure his line to Tyrion about being too much in the past will pay off. There’s still some kind of twist coming for Bran. Probably to open room for the spin off series.

—————

My bittersweet ending would be:

Dany’s dream of ending with corruption ends dead along with her. Jon bitter and alive at The Wall, back to his roots. Sansa alone being the lady that conquered it all with her smarts but is still alone and unhappy, nit necesarily a bad leader but hinting shades of the past ruthlessness. Brienne with the things she never thought could achieve (a family, knighthood, etc) but still suffering by the toll it took. And new generations growing up in spring (Sam, Brienne, Arya’s kids)… maybe Drogon will fly off and lay new eggs but will someone be able to hatch them? And finally Bran, dwelling in the past by the weirwood tree.

_________


Overall I think the producers underestimated this last season. They focused mostly on CGI and visuals, and sacrificed the writing which was what made the series great. They took for granted many aspects (like how could you spend millions on a dragon but overlook a cup of Starbucks right in the middle of the frame). I think we’ll have lots of unanswered questions and many angry fans all over.

I’m also sure the books will be completely different so that’s something I look up to.

She meant well by trying to be righteous and destroying the wheel but now she’s all about revenge. She doesn’t really trust the people around her anymore and she’s been held back many many times… I’m sure she will do whatever she wants and this will trigger Varys to act against her. However, I really think Jon will kill her, a new Queen Slayer and this will be her 3rd betrayal. I think Drogon is gonna burn the hell out of Euron.

4. VARYS AND TYRION: I can see Dany executing both of them for conspiracy. And then Dany will suspect Jon as well because he was the one who told Sansa the truth. Maybe Tyrion could survive but I’m not so sure.

5. JAMIE and CERSEI… I truly want to believe he is going back to Kings Landing to try to fix things with Cersei, and try to convince her of running away together or something. I could see Cersei killing him for being a traitor, for leaving her and accusing him of the loss of their unborn child. She’s paranoid so I think that once she sees herself loosing, she will kill herself by Jamie’s corpse side. Very Romeo and Juliette like.

6. ARYA… it was very on point for her to refuse Gendry on those terms of being a lady at a castle. I think she will help the Hound kill the Mountain and finally giving the Hound the gift of mercy. Afterall she’s regained contact with her humanity. I do see her going back to Storm’s End and being with Gendry but as a Master of arms or something on her own terms and him of course supporting her.

7. BRIENNE AND POD: I can see Brienne as the hand of Sansa and Pod as a Knight. Also, there’s room for Brienne to be having Jaimies twins. Afterall, it was kind of foreshadowed during thr drinking game by bringin up thr fact that she was an only child and a virgin.

8. Sam: I’m not sure if Sam’s role was just to read about dragon glass killing the white walkers but I’m sure he will write everything that happened on that night and will go back to his family’s castle.

9. Bran: I’m sure his line to Tyrion about being too much in the past will pay off. There’s still some kind of twist coming for Bran. Probably to open room for the spin off series.

—————

My bittersweet ending would be:

Dany’s dream of ending with corruption ends dead along with her. Jon bitter and alive at The Wall, back to his roots. Sansa alone being the lady that conquered it all with her smarts but is still alone and unhappy, nit necesarily a bad leader but hinting shades of the past ruthlessness. Brienne with the things she never thought could achieve (a family, knighthood, etc) but still suffering by the toll it took. And new generations growing up in spring (Sam, Brienne, Arya’s kids)… maybe Drogon will fly off and lay new eggs but will someone be able to hatch them? And finally Bran, dwelling in the past by the weirwood tree.

_________


Overall I think the producers underestimated this last season. They focused mostly on CGI and visuals, and sacrificed the writing which was what made the series great. They took for granted many aspects (like how could you spend millions on a dragon but overlook a cup of Starbucks right in the middle of the frame). I think we’ll have lots of unanswered questions and many angry fans all over.

I’m also sure the books will be completely different so that’s something I look up to.

blog.description: Hi! I'm a French shipper, fanfiction writer and reader and aspiring novelist! I'm a Gryffindor who supports House Stark and my Queen in the North until the end of the world, and a huge fan of SPN, Teen Wolf, Sherlock,  Harry Potter, GoT, Good Omens and lots of others! 💜💙💚

summary: Actually, Sansa was not angry when Daenerys legitimized Gendry.
title: Actually, Sansa was not angry when Daenerys legitimized Gendry.
body:
These are two screenshots of Sansa directly taken after Daenerys legitimizes Gendry and makes him a Lord at the head of one of the realms.

I think Sansa’s reaction was one of the most interesting of the whole episode, because we see raw emotion from Sansa - Sansa, who has been acting very cool for several episodes, with only a handful of moments when she lets the mask slip to reveal what she is feeling - happiness upon seeing Theon, pure terror when she is confronted with reanimated dead people trying to kill her.

I’ve read many (great) posts arguing that Sansa is angry at Daenerys because she knows that Daenerys has legitimized Gendry only to have his support. Or that she is angry because she knows Daenerys’ next step will be to legitimize Jon as Lord Stark, therefore stripping Sansa of her title and her power.

But in my opinion, this is not what Sansa is thinking right at this moment.

Look at her face. She looks shocked but also, very remarkably, sad and hurt. She is not angry: her face is not tense or twitched in anger, she doesn’t frown. Instead, her mouth is slightly open and the corners of her mouth are slightly lowered. There’s a small crease in her brow, there is a wrinkle in her brow, and, far from frowning, her eyebrows are slightly up. All of these are facial expressions for sadness. She looks about to cry.

And look how she quickly looks away, shocked and overcome with emotion. Holding back tears.

And THIS is the most telling element, here: Sansa’s eyes are wet and teary. She’s holding back tears, but not tears of emotion because what Daenerys did was so noble or whatnot (not saying it wasn’t, though). Sansa is clearly upset.

But her sadness and shock reveal that her reaction has not been caused by the fact that Daenerys will strip her from her power or by the fact that Daenerys gained a new ally. Had it been the case, we would have seen the typical Sansa reaction - cold, fierce, head up high, a smirk that says “I know what you’re doing here and I won’t let you win”, a determined gaze, ready to fight, never once looking away as if she couldn’t handle her emotions. So Sansa’s pain originates from something else.

The framing here is very interesting. Although Sansa seems to be looking at Daenerys, Jon is in the frame, just next to Sansa. It would have been easy to exclude him from this frame, to do as if he wasn’t there - by having Sansa looking right in front of her, for example, or by having a close-up to her face. But this is not the case and Jon is included in this frameshot, meaning that whatever is at stake here, and whatever it is that causes Sansa’s sadness, has to do with Jon.

But this frame, here, is not about representing a love triangle (for once) or to show the tension/rivalry/hatred between Sansa and Daenerys, because we do not get a shot of all three together (not in this scene, anyway) and we do not see a compilation of Sansa and Daenerys shots, looking at each other because they’re both playing the game.

No, this frame is about Sansa’s feelings alone, and Jon is at the center of them.

Look at this picture. Look closely.

Sansa is not looking at Daenerys at all. She can’t, because Jon is in the way. Sansa is looking at Jon and Jon only. I repeat it, once again: this moment is not about Daenerys or Daenerys vs. Sansa. For Sansa, it’s all about Jon.

Think about what has happened just before. Gendry, a bastard, has been legitimized and given a land that he never possessed, that he never administered, led or fought for. (Which is not something I hold against Gendry, and I don’t think Sansa does either.)

And who is sitting next to Sansa, next to Daenerys? Jon Snow. A bastard with no right to any land or to any title. Her bastard brother who fought for the North, who was named King in the North, who is supposed to be Daenerys’ lover. And yet he is not the one Daenerys legitimizes. He is not the one who is officially given a title and lands and a secure power position. He is not the one who officially becomes part of a family.

At this point, Sansa doesn’t know who Jon really is, even though Daenerys and Jon do - this is why both are showed sharing a smile, because Jon is not resentful, because he knows he is no bastard. This is why the camera does not focus on him while displaying Sansa’s sadness: Jon is not sad, he knows the truth and is thus unconscious of what Daenerys’ action means, from an exterior point of view (or would mean for him if he still thought he was a bastard) about his own situation.

But Sansa, who does not know yet, knows how much being a Stark means to Jon - Jon, who has said over and over again “I’m not a Stark” and who she had tried to reassure by telling him he is a Stark for her, by making him Stark furs. She knows he feels as if he didn’t belong, she knows he does not feel legitimate (both literally and metaphorically), she knows that he yearns for a family before anything else.

In this scene, Sansa is not thinking about power and scheming. She is thinking about her brother, cast aside once again when he deserves to be a Stark officially, and not legitimized when he should have been. She’s sad because she thinks of the pain he must be feeling to be rejected and still not accepted, as far as she knows. She is shocked, because it is not Jon Daenerys has legitimized, even though Jon should have been legitimized too, not only from her point of view, but from a logical angle too: as the Warden of the North and the Queen’s lover, it only makes sense that Daenerys should make him a Stark. If anything, Sansa feels for Jon because he is rejected and not accepted as a Stark by his own lover, which might be the saddest thing.

And if Sansa resents Daenerys (which is not shown in this scene, we only see her sadness and empathy, not her dislike for what Daenerys is doing), it is not about power. It is about neglecting and hurting her brother.

blog.name: northernredwolfqueen
blog.title: she is.

blog.name: queen-rhaenyra-targaryen
blog.title: The Realm's Delight
blog.description:
"Tell my half brother that I will have my throne, or I will have his head."
Simona. 27 years old. Italian.
Previously sapphirelily92. 
Artwork by Magali Villeneuve.

body:
Game of Thrones 8x04 spoilers

I don’t understand why Daenerys is considered nothing without her (male) counsellors, but Jon is considered a hero and a good commander for his own qualities.

Jon owes everything to the women around him. Ygritte saved him, Melisandre resurrected him, Lyanna made him King in the North, Sansa saved him in the Battle of Bastards and Arya killed his worst enemy.

The most miraculous thing he did, being resurrected, was done by someone else (and he didn’t even wanted to be resurrected), while Dany actively risked her life, against her most trusted counselor’s advice, in order to hatch the dragon eggs. She actively set fire to destroy the dothraki warlords.

I just don’t understand.

summary: Whenever I leave my dogs I tell them that I love them, they are the lights of my life, they are perfect in every way, I’m going...
body:
Whenever I leave my dogs I tell them that I love them, they are the lights of my life, they are perfect in every way, I’m going to miss them, I will think about them nonstop, I’ve never seen such beautiful ladies, and this is really hard for me.

Then I kiss their heads, rub their backsides, and give them uncomfortably long hugs that they have to wiggle out of, before apologizing profusely for leaving and reminding them that they have my number and should call me if they need anything.

Poor Ghost had the look of a pup who wanted a hug goodbye, maybe Jon’s been the true villain all along.
